{"id":1117404700,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 weeks, 5 days","timestamp":1702315189,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"28 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1117404700/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"58.4 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n\n\n    TreeNode* prev = NULL;\n    TreeNode* first = NULL;\n    TreeNode* second = NULL;\n    void inorder(TreeNode* root){\n        if(root == NULL){\n            return;\n        }\n        inorder(root->left);\n        if(prev && prev->val > root->val){\n            if(!first) first = prev;\n            second = root;\n        }\n        prev = root;\n        inorder(root->right);\n\n    }\n    void recoverTree(TreeNode* root) {\n        inorder(root);\n        int temp = first->val;\n        first->val = second->val;\n        second->val = temp;\n        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
